[quote name="frankbmd" post=1373141]McBride - the shrapnel variation - a true 1 of 1[/QUOTE]

As rare as a BL460. :D:D:D

When people become aware of how rare these truly are, prices will skyrocket. :eek::eek::eek: Get them now while you can!!!!!!!! :cool::cool::cool:

Frank, you have a tremendous eye, my friend. :D

Undervalued!!!!!!!!

Collectors just don't understand these. I do! :o

:D:eek::rolleyes::o

(Still looking for a Wags, by the way. Can anyone help? Plenty to trade ;))

Talking $187 or best offer 

You got it! I'll take the $187.00 and you can keep the card. Great deal! :D

Focus on the fine qualities of this specimen.  Don't be distracted by minor surface flaws.  This card manifests registration and centering seen only in high grade examples.  This is not some piece of "scrap" left on the printer's floor.  It is guaranteed authentic, but will not be available for long.

Get this card today.  A $10 offer will seal the deal.  Otherwise the card will be prepared for safe shipment to the current highest offer at 8 PM this evening.

Frank,

Save that puppy for me and add those Franks Bucks to my blossoming account. I'll send the $10 soon, thanks! Mike

PS I'm cool if you drop it in a regular white envelope and throw a 50c stamp on it, how much more damage can be done right? :)

Peace, Mike

PS after closer examination, I'm pretty sure that card was in a Soldier's pocket during WW1. Looks like Ardennes Forest dirt and a hint of fragments from the famous: Mills bomb, designed by William Mills in 1915. I'm sure of it!
Someone got a steal. Add two zeroes to that selling price. :eek::eek::eek::D:cool:
